output.conclusion: By completing this course, you've gained a foundational understanding of Multimodal AI, its applications, and how to start building your own multimodal systems. You are now equipped to explore more advanced topics and contribute to this exciting field.
output.introduction: Welcome to the world of Multimodal AI! This course will guide you through the basics of AI systems that can understand and process information from multiple sources, like images, text, and audio. No prior AI experience is required!

chapters.description: An introduction to the concept of Multimodal AI, explaining how it combines different data types (modalities) like text, images, and audio to create more comprehensive AI systems.
Discussing the advantages of using multiple modalities, such as improved accuracy, robustness, and a more human-like understanding of the world.
Listing common modalities used in AI, including text, images, audio, video, and sensor data, with brief explanations of each.

chapters.chapterTitle: Image and Text: Visual Question Answering
chapters.description: Explaining how AI can answer questions about images by combining image recognition with natural language processing.
Describing how AI converts spoken language into text, enabling voice assistants and transcription services.
Explaining how AI can automatically generate descriptions for videos, making content more accessible and searchable.
Discussing the importance of gathering and cleaning data from different modalities for training a Multimodal AI model.
Explaining how to extract relevant features from each modality, such as visual features from images and semantic features from text.
Introducing different methods for combining features from multiple modalities, such as early fusion and late fusion.
Briefly introducing popular tools and libraries for Multimodal AI development, such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, and Hugging Face Transformers.
Presenting a simplified example of a Multimodal AI model using a high-level framework to illustrate the basic steps.
Providing links to further learning resources, datasets, and research papers for those interested in delving deeper into Multimodal AI.

modules.moduleTitle: Getting Started with Multimodal AI Development
